meanings.definition: A group of people who are in charge of a particular organization or department.
meanings.sent1: The directorate met to discuss the budget for the upcoming year.
meanings.sent2: The directorate of the company made important decisions about the new project.
meanings.sent3: The directorate's pizza party was a fun way to plan the next big event.
meanings.sent4: She ruled the directorate with an iron fist, ensuring everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The directorate's unity and leadership were crucial during the crisis.

meanings.definition: The term used to refer to the position or status of being a director.
meanings.sent1: Her promotion to the directorate was a significant milestone in her career.
meanings.sent2: He aspired to reach the directorate level within the company.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a top hat and monocle, he joked that he had finally achieved directorate status.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chess, the queen holds the directorate position, commanding the board.
meanings.sent5: The directorate title added a sense of authority and responsibility to his role.
